channel.title: Patch Won't Go Live
channel.description:
Hi,
I'm having a problem with my Axoloti board where I can't get new patches to go live, for some reason when I click the live button it un ticks itself and the background on the patcher stays the same colour.
I've tried using various USB cables and tried loading patches i've made myself and ones from the library but for some reason a old patch is still loaded on the board.
I am on firmware version 1.0.0.1 hopefully this is just me being stupid and there is a easy fix so I can get the axoloti working again!
Thanks, Dan
Edit: just realised I probably should have mentioned, I am using Windows 10!

item.title: Patch Won't Go Live
item.dc:creator: @dngdwn Dan Goodwin
item.description:
@dngdwn wrote:

Thanks, Iâ€™ll try taking it into work or using my girlfriends laptop and see if I have any luck with that.

Read full topic

item.title: Patch Won't Go Live
item.dc:creator: @weasel79 blender
item.description:
@weasel79 wrote:

yeah especially with going back and forth with the complicated 2.0 install i would definitely recommend to try the board on a different computer with a fresh axoloti 1 install. easiest way to trouble shoot whether its the board or the software.

Read full topic

item.title: Patch Won't Go Live
item.dc:creator: @reubenfinger
item.description:
@reubenfinger wrote:

Do you have another computer to try it on, might seem like an odd suggestion and probably a long shot, but a long while ago when I first started to use Axo, I was running the patcher on two different versions of OSX, and couldn't connect at all on my music machine, and went through all of the suggestions for pressing S2 and putting it into DFU mode, the issue was solved when I used my day to day computer with a different os and managed to get it into DFU mode, then I did a clean install on the mac that wouldn't connect.....

Like I say a long shot also (I'm sure you may have already done this) different usb cable, the micro usb is fraught with connection problems, I use a magnetic cable now so that I'm not constantly plugging and unplugging the micro usb connector

Read full topic

Has anyone got any more ideas?

item.title: Patch Won't Go Live
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

can you try and startup with s2 pressed? that should prevent any startup patches to run. i had a couple of weird errors when a bogus startup patch was on the axoloti.

item.title: Patch Won't Go Live
item.dc:creator: @dngdwn Dan Goodwin
item.description:
@dngdwn wrote:

I've flashed firmware version 1.0.0.1 onto my board and reinstalled that version of Axoloti.

However I still have the same issue I used to have when I click the live button and it just unchecks itself and the patcher stays the same colour, I've included the messages from the log screen below.

"Done uploading patch
Starting patch...
Done starting patch
Start locking
Done locking
Disconnect request
USB device found
connected
Authentic Axoloti Core
Firmware version: 1.0.0.1, crc=0xE95BAC96, entrypoint=0x20011000
Generate code complete
Start compiling patch
The screen cannot be set to the number of lines and columns specified.
Done compiling patch
Start uploading patch
bin path: C:\Users\dango\Documents\axoloti\build\xpatch.bin
block uploaded @ 0x20011000 length 7408
Done uploading patch
Starting patch...
Done starting patch
Start locking
Done locking"

Read full topic

item.title: Patch Won't Go Live
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

if i remember correctly you either have to downgrade from axoloti 2 (there should be an option to downgrade to 1.0.12) or do it via dfu mode, i think that could also work.
so, downgrading via ver.1 editor is not possible.

Read full topic

item.title: Patch Won't Go Live
item.dc:creator: @dngdwn Dan Goodwin
item.description:
@dngdwn wrote:

I've gone back to version 1.0.12-2, however when I run Axoloti it says there is a firmware mismatch and when I say to flash the new firmware it seems to get stuck.

FYI, I did update the firmware when I installed version 2, should it be possible for me to downgrade the firmware?

Read full topic

item.title: Patch Won't Go Live
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

well your axoloti was working with the version 1, and now you are trying to install version 2. i for one would opt to remove axoloti version 2 and install the old "known to work" axoloti version 1. it will be easier for you to find help on that one.

Read full topic

item.title: Patch Won't Go Live
item.dc:creator: @dngdwn Dan Goodwin
item.description:
@dngdwn wrote:

To be precise I installed the toolkit in "C:\Program Files (x86)".

I never had this installed when my Axoloti used to work however, would maybe uninstalling everything and searching for any registry keys associated with Axoloti to get a complete clean slate help?

Thanks to everyone who's offered help so far and apologies for my persistence, I would just like to get my Axoloti working again if possible!

Read full topic

https://developer.arm.com/tools-and-software/open-source-software/developer-tools/gnu-toolchain/gnu-rm/downloads/7-2018-q2-update

Is this what I should be installing regardless?
